module.p:
rach athair ... a father goes ... –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. Thòisich am màthair air obair an taighe aig fichead mionaid an déidh sia, agus chaidh an athair a mach a bhiadhadh a’ chrùidh aig leth-uair an déidh sia.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. Their mother started on the housework at twenty minutes past six, and their father went out to feed the cattle at half past six. td. 183

li.gd: An do dh’fhan Màiri aig an taigh an diugh? Cha do dh’fhan. Chaidh Màiri do’n sgoil anns a’ mhadainn
li.tr: Did Mary stay at home today? No, she didn’t. She went to school in the morning.

li.gd: Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil.
li.tr: Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school.

module.p:
rach ... do sgoil ... goes to a school –
An do dh’fhan Màiri aig an taigh an diugh? Cha do dh’fhan. Chaidh Màiri do’n sgoil anns a’ mhadainn
Did Mary stay at home today? No, she didn’t. She went to school in the morning. td. 237–8
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. td. 182–3

cf. rach sgoil [a-staigh] a school goes [in], ie. [the children] go into a school –
’S e an Dùdlachd a bha ann agus bha e fhathast dorcha nuair a dh’fhàg a’ chlann an taigh, ach ràinig iad an sgoil gu sàbhailte aig cóig mionaidean gu naoi. Chaidh an sgoil a staigh aig naoi uairean.
It was December and it was still dark when the children left the house, but they reached the school safely at five minutes to nine. The school went in at nine o’clock. td. 183

rach ... a bhiadhadh ... ... goes to feed ... –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. Thòisich am màthair air obair an taighe aig fichead mionaid an déidh sia, agus chaidh an athair a mach a bhiadhadh a’ chrùidh aig leth-uair an déidh sia.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. Their mother started on the housework at twenty minutes past six, and their father went out to feed the cattle at half past six. td. 183

rach ... ann am madainn ... goes ... of a morning –
An do dh’fhan Màiri aig an taigh an diugh? Cha do dh’fhan. Chaidh Màiri do’n sgoil anns a’ mhadainn
Did Mary stay at home today? No, she didn’t. She went to school in the morning. td. 237–8

rach ... aig ... uair ... ... goes ... at ... o’clock ... –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. Thòisich am màthair air obair an taighe aig fichead mionaid an déidh sia, agus chaidh an athair a mach a bhiadhadh a’ chrùidh aig leth-uair an déidh sia.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. Their mother started on the housework at twenty minutes past six, and their father went out to feed the cattle at half past six. td. 183
